item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "Man, being reasonable, must get drunk; the best of life is but intoxication." -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lord Byron
item.description: "Like the measles, love is most dangerous when it comes late in life." -- Lord Byron

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Wilmot, Earl of Rochester
item.description: "I have to speak my mind. Because what is in my mind is always more interesting than what is happening in the world outside my mind." -- John Wilmot, Earl of Rochester

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Stephen Jeffreys
item.description: "You must acquire the trick of ignoring those who do not like you. In my experience, those who do not like you fall into two categories: the stupid, and the envious. The stupid will like you in five years time, the envious never." -- Stephen Jeffreys

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Hans Christian Anderson
item.description: "Es gibt keinen anderen Teufel, als den wir in unserem eigenen Herzen haben. " -- Hans Christian Anderson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lord Byron
item.description: "Society is now one polish'd horde, Form'd of two mighty tribes, the Bores and Bored." -- Lord Byron
